# The `IndirectThunks.h` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Contains a base ThunkInserter class that simplifies injection of MI thunks as well as a default implementation of MachineFunctionPass wrapping several <code>ThunkInserter</code>s for targets to extend. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Contains a base ThunkInserter class that simplifies injection of MI thunks as well as a default implementation of MachineFunctionPass wrapping several <code>ThunkInserter</code>s for targets to extend.

<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinefunction-h">llvm/CodeGen/MachineFunction.h</a>&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class assists in inserting MI thunk functions into the module and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// rewriting the existing machine functions to call these thunks.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// One of the common cases is implementing security mitigations that involve</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// replacing some machine code patterns with calls to special thunk functions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Inserting a module pass late in the codegen pipeline may increase memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// usage, as it serializes the transformations and forces preceding passes to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// produce machine code for all functions before running the module pass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For that reason, ThunkInserter can be driven by a MachineFunctionPass by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// passing one MachineFunction at a time to its &#96;run(MMI, MF)&#96; method.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Then, the derived class should</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; call createThunkFunction from its insertThunks method exactly once for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">///   each of the thunk functions to be inserted</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; populate the thunk in its populateThunk method</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that if some other pass is responsible for rewriting the functions,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the insertThunks method may simply create all possible thunks at once,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// probably postponed until the first occurrence of possibly affected MF.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Alternatively, insertThunks method can rewrite MF by itself and only insert</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the thunks being called. In that case InsertedThunks variable can be used</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to track which thunks were already inserted.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In any case, the thunk function has to be inserted on behalf of some other</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function and then populated on its own &quot;iteration&quot; later - this is because</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MachineFunctionPass will see the newly created functions, but they first</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// have to go through the preceding passes from the same pass manager,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">/// possibly even through the instruction selector.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME Maybe implement a documented and less surprising way of modifying</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       the module from a MachineFunctionPass that is restricted to inserting</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       completely new functions to the module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Derived, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> InsertedThunksTy = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/thunkinserter"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/thunkinserter">ThunkInserter</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="normal">  Derived &amp;getDerived() &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">Derived &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">); &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A variable used to track whether (and possible which) thunks have been</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// inserted so far. InsertedThunksTy is usually a bool, but can be other types</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to represent more than one type of thunk. Requires an |= operator to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// accumulate results.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Create an empty thunk function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The new function will eventually be passed to populateThunk. If multiple</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// thunks are created, populateThunk can distinguish them by their names.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we already made. Create them and insert them into the module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// respected.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!getDerived().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/thunkinserter/#a0e76d9a11bcf2f5bb6b8842ae88ebf9e">mayUseThunk</a>(MF))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The target can use InsertedThunks to detect whether relevant thunks</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have already been inserted.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: Provide the way for insertThunks to notify us whether it changed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        the MF, instead of conservatively assuming it did.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal">    InsertedThunks |= getDerived().insertThunks(MMI, MF, InsertedThunks);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this &#42;is&#42; a thunk function, we need to populate it with the correct MI.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal">  getDerived().populateThunk(MF);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
